bibl.title: Dispatch from Robert S. Newton to the Assistant Secretary of State
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.opener: United States Consulate at St Paul de Loanda
div1.p: Mr Robert Scott Newton To the Deparment of State
United States Consulate St Paul de Loanda 16th September 1881.

Sir I have the honor to request the Department to grant me leave of absence for 6 months as both the partners in my Commercial firm having died in April last; it may be absolutely necessary that I should visit Europe about February or March. I will arrange with one of my friends to take charge of the consulate during my absence, whose name I will advise in good time to the Department. As I only intend going to treat of business matters I do not expect to be away for a longer period than for 4 months.
I have the honor to be Sir Your most Obedient Servant Rob S. Newton Vice Consul
To the Assistant Secretary of State Washington D.C.
